snippet: The ruling said a grand jury received bad instructions before indicting Officer Richard Haste in the shooting of Ramarley Graham.
abstract: Bronx Judge Steven Barrett of New York State Supreme Court dismisses charges against New York City Police Officer Richard Haste, who shot and killed unarmed 18-year-old Ramarley Graham in his family's home; Bronx district attorney's office may appeal or try to bring new charges.
lead_paragraph: The ruling said a grand jury received bad instructions before indicting Officer Richard Haste in the shooting of Ramarley Graham.

headline.seo: Charges Dismissed in Officer’s Killing of Unarmed Teenager
headline.main: Bronx Judge Dismisses Charges in ’12 Killing by Officer; New Indictment Is Possible
headline.print_headline: Bronx Judge Dismisses Charges in ’12 Killing by Officer; New Indictment Is Possible
